content.description: Climb the overhanging boulder through the first two bolts and a few big reaches to a jug. From the jug make an extremely thin and cruxy traverse right to the third bolt, after you’ve clipped the third bolt reach around the arête to a bomber hand jam. Pull around the arête and head straight up to a single bolt anchor. You may want to bring a few pieces of gear to back the single bolt up.
content.protection: 3 bolts, and a single anchor bolt.
content.location: This is the first route at the Western Pillars if you’re heading down the hill from the wooden staircase. From the base of the staircase take a right down the hill, and look for the prominent and overhanging boulder on your right with three bolts on it. You can also access this route by heading uphill up the gully from the South Slabs, if you’re going to it from the South Slabs this will be the last route you come to on your left.

content.description: Climb the left leaning flakes past the first bolt to a good horizontal that takes gear, from the horizontal make a descent reach up to a good crimp and the second bolt. Once you’ve got the second bolt make a cruxy reach up and right off small holds to a good crimp. From the crimp make one more hard move to a jug up and left that will take you to the top of the slab, build a gear anchor or lower from the cord with two quicklinks on it.
content.location: Easily accessed by walking past the South Slabs and taking a right and heading up hill in the gully, the route will be on your left and facing south, it is easily spotted by the two bolts. You can also access the route by heading down the hill from the wooden staircase on the main trail. The route will be on your right and is a few hundred feet down the hill from True Grit.

content.description: A few fun climbs that are worth doing if you’re exploring the Wintergreen area.
